title: The Ten Suggestions
content: - 7 -   sympathy more times than you can count.  Speaking as somebody who has   been happily married for 35 years, I can’t imagine any choice more   consequential for a lifelong journey than the choice of a traveling companion.       10.  Call your mom and dad once in a while.  A time will come when you will   want your own grown-up, busy, hyper-successful children to call you.  Also,   remember who paid your tuition to Princeton.    Those are my suggestions.   They’re probably worth exactly what you paid for   them.  But they come from someone who shares your affection for this great institution   and who wishes you the best for the future.   Congratulations, graduates.  Give ’em hell.
